Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the role of the Department of Energy in blocking Texas from increasing power ahead of the storm.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the Department of Energy intentionally blocked Texas from increasing power.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the emergency order issued by the Department of Energy was meant to throttle power output and prioritize green energy standards, which is a problematic assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided by the expert, stating that the emergency order was actually meant to temporarily suspend federal emissions caps and allow power plants to operate at maximum capacity.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Department of Energy did not block Texas from increasing power production.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
Falters at times: There is no indication of the claim faltering at times.
